website_summaries.verdict: This simply constructed binocular strap is impressive in functionality and comfort, making it an ideal choice for anyone in the market for one.
pros: Comfortable strap for all day wear, made out of comfortably soft material that's grippy enough to stay in place
Easy to adjust the tightness of strap and has generous length
Available in a multitude of colors
cons: Since straps are wide, may take some time to attach to binoculars

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfully light weight and useful!
customer_reviews.text: I have this and another (much larger) OP/TECH strap. I really like this one for my 5D + 24-70mm f/2.8 and on my 7D mk II + 18-135 IS. I thought I'd want the bigger one when using the f/2.8 glass: Nope. Don't need it. This "little" strap does great even with some real weight on it. I think I'll only break out that big one if I'm shooting the 70-200 f/2.8 on a body with a grip. But, if I did that, I'd be on a monopod. Hmm... I'm not sure there's a reason for me to ever use the bigger strap!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Jx

customer_reviews.title: Comfy neckstrap!
customer_reviews.text: Offered as an option for my papillo binoculars, which is a 1/4" strap, I purchased this for the comfort aspect, and found it to be a 3/8" strap. I had the patience to weave it through fittings and binoculars, with pliers and screwdriver. Not their fault that website for binoculars offered it as an option. Glad I got it anyway, after initial 1hour wrestling match. This is real comfortable, and would by again for something that required a 3/8" strap!
customer_reviews.author: John Fuik

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: I went whale watching and soon found out that binoculars with a strap are much more comfortable and easy to use. This strap is simple and simply what I needed. It is for occasional use so durability is not an issue for me. This is a good value and looks sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Basic and Cushy product
customer_reviews.text: Light and durable materials for a basic task of keeping your binoculars secure. Easily secured to two different pairs of 10 x 50 wide angle units. Nicely padded central piece around the neck where most of the weight will bear.
customer_reviews.author: Hayseed

customer_reviews.title: the neoprene is only 1 1/4" wide and (at least for me) isn't comfortable or as wide as I like
customer_reviews.text: The strap itself is 3/8" wide & won't fit in the strap connectors on the Compact Nikon 8x-24x Zoom Binoculars which is only 3/16" wide I bought with them and which were recommended/suggested. Additionally, the neoprene is only 1 1/4" wide and (at least for me) isn't comfortable or as wide as I like. I prefer a 1 3/4"-2" wide neoprene strap. Aside from these facts, it seems to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: QuietOne

customer_reviews.title: Neck Strap for Cameras and Binoculars
customer_reviews.text: My wife needed a new neck strap for her binoculars: this was an excellent replacement. She is very happy with the strap and said it is very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Hasn't dropped a camera yet.
customer_reviews.text: The strap is decent quality and durable, I've had one for years. My only complaint is that the neoprene portion is too short for my large neck and the sewn on tabs chafe, but it is no less comfortable than the factory Canon straps I've used it to replace. It would be nice if they made it with or offered a unit with a longer padded portion. Note I got this for a recently acquired EOS M and the straps on it are too wide and do not fit the camera. They are properly sized for standard EOS cams.
customer_reviews.author: myootnt

customer_reviews.title: The Non-Nikon/Non-Canon Strap
customer_reviews.text: The only camera strap you'll ever need. Personally I hate advertising what kind of camera I use. So I buy one of these for every new camera body I buy. And then in a few years, I have to buy another, because they do fray, but that is why you have one.
customer_reviews.author: J Milton

customer_reviews.title: Ouch. This HURTS.
customer_reviews.text: I got this strap for wearing convention badges, so I could be more comfortable. It had the opposite effect; the edge of the foam is not finished at all, just rough-cut, and it's hard and abrasive.
customer_reviews.author: B. Figrim

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy neoprene camera strap
customer_reviews.text: Used with a Canon 5Dsr and 70-200 f/2.8 lens. Makes the camera feel lighter than with the factory strap.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ho

customer_reviews.title: Comfort without the bulk
customer_reviews.text: I got the E-Z Comfort neck strap for my binoculars and they're exactly what I needed: soft, supple, comfortable, distributing the weight of the equipment a lot better than those horrible, coarse, thin straps that ship with most binoculars. It doesn't chafe my neck and I barely remember the binoculars are there. I had anon the binoculars, but it was overkill for them: it's a great strap, built for heavier equipment. So this one ended on my camera and the new E-Z Comfort is now on the binoculars. I think they're both perfect for the use I've given them.
customer_reviews.author: ubatTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: binoculars and works perfect. Takes the strain off in times you do ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the replacement strap for a Celestron 25x70 astronomical, heavy, binoculars and works perfect. Takes the strain off in times you do not have the binoculars mounted on a tripod. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: VSG

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement strap
customer_reviews.text: This strap is great to replace your original camera strap with. I never really had comfort issues with my original strap, but I needed one to replace it with. I chose this one for the great reviews it had and the low price. It does spread the weight out more and make it more comfortable to hold my camera, but that is only noticeable if I have my large zoom lens and extended battery pack on. I would recommend this to anyone simply based on its' price and durability. I do not notice a huge difference in comfort over the original strap, but I'm sure it is different for each person.
customer_reviews.author: James Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good neck strap
customer_reviews.text: I bought this strap because I didn't realize the binoculars I ordered came with a good neck strap. I have another pair of binoculars with a crappy strap. I installed this one and it's a definite improvement. The only negative I can see is that the neoprene will make my neck sweat in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce C.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit Nikon ProStaff binocs, get QD attachment
customer_reviews.text: Nice strap, very comfortable. I should have checked sizing first. My new Nikon ProStaff 10x25 binoculars require a 5 mm strap. The width of this Op/Tech USA E-Z Comfort Strap is 3/8" so I can't possibly get it to attach. Am going to see if I can get same Op/Tech strap in the right size for the binoculars! Update: Can buy a QD (Quick Disconnect) attachment which should solve problem for an extra 5 bucks or so. Hooray!
customer_reviews.author: L. Jack

customer_reviews.title: Better than Nikon strap
customer_reviews.text: I am a Nikon fan, but this strap is way more comfortable than the stock strap. Neoprene pad is very comfortable. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly for my binoculars
customer_reviews.text: Needed for a pair of binoculars and it worked perfectly. Good quality. Fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No free advertisement for manufacturers. Oh, and it's very comfortable too!
customer_reviews.text: I've been a big fan of OpTech strap since I started shooting. Neoprene strap is very comfortable on your neck and it acts (in a very limited manner) as shock absorber when you walk/run with your camera hanging on your neck. What I like the most about this strap? No *huge* manufacturer's name on the strap. Going with Nikon stock strap, it's a huge "NIKON" there. Why giving them free advertisement? If I can buy my camera without its model/brand etched on the body, I would have. I love being low-profile, and this strap, in a way, help me with that.
customer_reviews.author: D-T-D

customer_reviews.title: So Much Better Compared to the OEM strap which came with my T1i
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a Canon T1i (500D). I love the camera and em enjoying it thoroughly but I didnt like my neck strap for 2 reasons - 1) It is not comfortable because its too wide, made out of stiff material causing irritation on the skin of contact. 2) It has Canon printed on it in big capital letters.. which somehow looks cheap. I wanted something which was comfortable and didnt have any brand printed on it. This strap as other reviewers have mentioned is extremely comfortable, fits perfectly for my T1i and looks durable. For the price which is under 10, it is an A+ purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Anand

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  I should have bought 2 !
customer_reviews.text: I'm using it with my heavy Canon EOS-40D and WoW! It is very Comfortable and very well finished. I did not expect so much out of a product that is priced so reasonably. When you put it on the first time you fear that the neoprene stretches so much that it feels fragile, but no worries! I have tested it and stretched it a lot and it is very sturdy. I don't believe anyone could yank hard enough to break it. All that's missing to make it a 60$ strap is a white bran name on it. But I would not pay the extra 55$ for that.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Politick

customer_reviews.title: Made in USA
customer_reviews.text: Made in the USA and very comfortable. It distributes the weigh of the camera nicely and does not dig into the back of my neck.
customer_reviews.author: no name

customer_reviews.title: I can see these being good for a very heavy item but with the binoculars ...
customer_reviews.text: I can see these being good for a very heavy item but with the binoculars they were recommended for they are overkill. The strap is to wide and a bit uncomfortable. Quality of the product is good.
customer_reviews.author: Tsavo

customer_reviews.title: Nice strap but would not fit my point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a new Panasonic Lumix DMC ZS-50. I like neck straps and the ZS-50 has a strap lug on both sides. The OP/TECH web site has a product finder and showed the E-Z Comfort strap would fit the ZS-50. The strap width is 3/8" while the camera lug width is 1/2". I contacted OP/TECH and they verified their web site has not been updated for some smaller cameras and would be updating the site. I'll need to find a strap that uses the small loops with a quick-release clip. The good news is it's a very nice strap and would deserve 5 stars if I could have used it.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Rider

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's hard to argue with it. I find that Optech materials generally at least seem inferior to Tamrac, but it's an improvement anyway over the straps provided by the camera manufacturers. For comfort I think it comes down to width rather than material. I would like to see one of the strap companies make a wide but very thin/lightweight strap so bulk can be reduced for packing/traveling.
customer_reviews.author: arubeito

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: It's good but I did not realize my binoculars came with almost the exact same neck strap so it was really a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: april showers

customer_reviews.title: This strap is amazing. It alleviates the strain associated with other similar ...
customer_reviews.text: This strap is amazing. It alleviates the strain associated with other similar type straps and it is interchangeable as well. I like the way it balances.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable. Excellent Price.
customer_reviews.text: I was looling for a strap that would be better than the standard neck digger that came with my Canon XS. I looked around and found this one here on Amazon. I thought at first this was gonna be some cheap thing that would break right after buying it. After reading the reviews here and taking it on a trip this last weekend I gotta say this thing is fantastic. I wore it during a kids fishing derby for about 3 hours and it was so comfortable that I forgot I had the camera around my neck. The 2 other fathers with me on the trip are now also buying the strap.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Swenson

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: This strap is reasonably sturdy and easy to apply on my binoculars. If I ever need another strap, i would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Gegg

customer_reviews.title: 1000% better than a shoestring!
customer_reviews.text: Simply works! I’m happy with the price, the quality & the comfort. Nothing fancy here. This is my second purchase of this product & I’m still happily using the original as well.
customer_reviews.author: Blam8o

customer_reviews.title: Very good basic camer/binocular strap.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these straps. One for our D-SLR camera and one for our full size 10X50 binoculars. The strap works very well for both of these applications. The only complaint is that it could be a bit wider. There was an error made in the shipping cost. Shipping cost were applied to each strap even though they shipped in the same package. We called this error to Op/Tech's attention and it was resolved immediately. I would buy this item again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was a beautiful strap but it wouldn't fit on my zs 60
customer_reviews.text: It was a beautiful strap but it wouldn't fit on my zs 60. I tried to trim it to fit and destroyed it. Sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Quality!  Good Value!
customer_reviews.text: Way, way better than stock! Since binoculars and cameras are instruments you ostensibly "wear", don't chintz on the neck strap! It makes a big difference over the course of a long day or evening! This item would make a great stocking stuffer for binocular and camera enthusiasts alike! RayB
customer_reviews.author: RayB

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy everything they list with purchase unless you check item first.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t fit Binoculars that I bought! Problem use on camera!
customer_reviews.author: Carpenter done

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Has a little more cushion for around the neck, the ones that came with were a little thinner.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W Barbour

customer_reviews.title: A camera strap that won't leave you with a sore neck
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Op/Tech strap I've bought. It's light and soft on the neck. The neoprene has enough give that the weight of the camera isn't jerking on my neck. I also use a similar strap on my binoculars. That's when I discovered the shock absorber effect of the neoprene strap.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good strap!
customer_reviews.text: The only complain I have about this strap is that the padded part is to short and where the neoprene meets the rest of the strap falls right in my collar bones, this is sometimes annoying and uncomfortable. Other than that it is a pretty solid product for the price. I would recommend it if you don't want to use the flashy strap that came with your camera, which is my case.
customer_reviews.author: Nosferatu

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: This is an extra extra nice neck strap. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: OK, but not great
customer_reviews.text: The nylon webbing of the strap and the buckles are nice and substantial. The part I didn't really like was the padded part that goes at the back of your neck. It's made of what is essentially wet-suit material, not cloth-covered or reinforced, and that makes me pretty suspicious of its durability. All in all, it's an OK strap, though.
customer_reviews.author: James C Wells Jr

customer_reviews.title: Facilitates use of medium/large binoculars
customer_reviews.text: Some binoculars in the 2 to 3 lb range are equipped with straps not adequate to prevent neck discomfort. This wide, padded strap ameliorates that problem. It is well constructed and should last indefinitely.
customer_reviews.author: starfan

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I though the wide neck band would be beneficial but it rubbed on my neck leaving a rash.
customer_reviews.author: hootnhollow

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Discovered strap that came with binoculars provided a better fit.
customer_reviews.author: PAUL ZURICH

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: This product is not soft and digs into your neck. It might be okay for a big man...?
customer_reviews.author: Missy Moo's Mom

customer_reviews.title: What I expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of Bushnell binoculars on Amazon. I wanted a binocular strap with cushion. This strap was advertised along with the binoculars. They looked like what I wanted so I ordered it also. I immediately attached it to my binoculars. I have not used it yet. But by my examination of the strap, it is what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Den

customer_reviews.title: Perfect strap
customer_reviews.text: Perfect strap, light, comfy, simple and secure. Buying it again after my original wore out after 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime E. Espinoza

customer_reviews.title: Strap that fits and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Good, comfortable strap. I, too, was a little concerned about the thickness. We use this product on a pair of binoculars from the '70s who knows where the original strap is. Anyway, it is comfortable and could not beat the price and it was easy to put on, adjust, etc. Glad to purchase a quality product made in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: DLightful Living Young

customer_reviews.title: Perfect; satisfied case needs.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect purchase for an older leather case replacing a dried out original strap...
customer_reviews.author: NGlobalN

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable to wear with my binoculars. Well made, easy to attach.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Warner

customer_reviews.title: Not as comfortable as I hoped.
customer_reviews.text: I found this just as itchy and uncomfortable as my original strap. Darn. Okay quality---but not super comfy in any way.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Great Pad on the strap, but it is too short
customer_reviews.text: The strap I received does not match the picture at all. It has a great soft grippy pad, that I like, but it is way too short. Overall it is only 31in. (Compared to 51in on a standard Nikon strap) After you fasten it properly to your camera, it leaves you with maybe 25in. Which is barely enough to put your head through. If you are wearing a jacket, you can forget about wearing it over your shoulder, unless you want it to rub on your underarms. That sucks, because I like that pad a lot.I just stopped using that strap and went to a different brand until I can come up with some way to extend it.
customer_reviews.author: OhioPhotoPro

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice sturdy & comfortable strap I can use in the field with my cameras or binoculars. I love OP/TECH products!
customer_reviews.author: winterfrost

customer_reviews.title: It is a good value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this not for a camera but for a new set of binoculars. It is comfortable. To be honest if I had known the binoculars came with a strap (they did) but it was not mentioned. So I bought this inexpensive strap. It is comfortable, it is a good quality strap and secure. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Newer version of an old favorite.
customer_reviews.text: They've updated/changed the strap in that you can no longer unsnap the strap and leave the connecting pieces on the camera. It's ok though, it was a feature I never used anyway. Strap material is still that great, cushiony, stretchy stuff. Love this strap. Makes the camera feel like it weighs less on your neck.
customer_reviews.author: MJinCP

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good value, fit my large frame binoculars perfectly. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Harold W. Melius

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if I really needed it, because the ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I really needed it, because the binoculars already can with one that would have worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sabina

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: It's a more comfortable alternative to cheap cord straps. It rides about mid-chest on me, which is what I like because whatever is on it doesn't swish around as much when it's mounted higher.
customer_reviews.author: Bob T.

customer_reviews.title: Good strap at the right price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my video camera just before my vacation. It is comfortable and sturdy. It does not give irritation on the back of ones neck like other straps I own. Shipped quickly at the normal shipping rate. I'm thinking about getting one for my digital camera.
customer_reviews.author: Soujourner Truth

customer_reviews.title: Very good products.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my wife along with binoculars. Very good products.
customer_reviews.author: Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good product - fite my expensive binocs for hunting well. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strap is too stiff
customer_reviews.text: I wear binoculars for long periods at a time, and I was hoping that, as with other straps I have used, it would be softer and more comfortable. It is very stiff.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition to my binoculars!
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered some nice binoculars but they came with a very thin strap that hurt my neck. Once I received this strap I am able to use them for hours at sporting events. A great addition and a great value from Op/Tech.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: These straps worked wonderfully on my binoculars as a replacement strap. Very comfortable to use. My only gripe is they make my neck sweaty a very minor thing. I would recommend as they appear to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Best Strap Ever Purchased
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. The thick band behind your deck has lots of cushion and is expandable. Purchased for Nikon binoculars. Extremely comfortable. Would definitely recommend buying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Big improvement over the cheap strap that came with my expensive binoculars Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Ranger Stan

customer_reviews.title: For the price, worthy of 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little strap for the price. It may not be the best in the world, but for the price I don't think it can be beat. I used it for a neck strap for my Panasonic TM700 camcorder and it seems to be the perfect size for a small camcorder like that. It's also comfortable around the neck.
customer_reviews.author: Lantana Al

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: Chinese Price, American Made Quality. Very comfortable to use with my binoculars. Quality seems to be top notch. Very thick and cushy neck strap.
customer_reviews.author: BSB

customer_reviews.title: Would buy this strap again.
customer_reviews.text: Terrific quality, optec is a fine brand, this lives up to the brnad's reputation.
customer_reviews.author: Svengali

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the flimsy strap that came with my binoculars. Very comfortable. Would recommend this to anyone who has to carry something bulky around their neck (camera, binoculars, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: Dean F

customer_reviews.title: Should not have been sold as an accessory when a better one is provided with the product
customer_reviews.text: Not needed. Should not have been sold as an accessory when a better one is provided with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Comstock sr.

customer_reviews.title: Well made and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Nice small strap for lightweight cameras or lens cases. Good match for the Nikon Coolpix and d5100 and lighter cameras with the kit lenses. If you have a heavier camera or one of the super zoom lenses I suggest you get one of their heavier straps.
customer_reviews.author: MetalMariachi

customer_reviews.title: This strap is very uncomfortable. Used it on a ...
customer_reviews.text: This strap is very uncomfortable. Used it on a birding trip and ended up throwing it away when i returned. It digs into the back of the neck and I found myself having to constantly adjust the position of it - quite a distraction.
customer_reviews.author: Lori R

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't have any grippy aspect like the larger straps so it likes to slip off ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have any grippy aspect like the larger straps so it likes to slip off your shoulder a lot. Probably something I will remedy my self.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice strap very comfortable carrying my binoculars with these. would recommend them to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Jerry D Davis

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive upgrade to OEM camera strap
customer_reviews.text: Optech delivers well made, good value products, and this is no exception. For a few $ is so much better than the camera strap provided w camera you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. A definite upgrade to the strap provided with the binoculars I bought.
customer_reviews.author: loves2shop

customer_reviews.title: Recommended as a "buy with" Pentax 62211 UCF-X II 8x25 ...
customer_reviews.text: Recommended as a "buy with" Pentax 62211 UCF-X II 8x25 Binoculars but it is not compatible. No way to attach.
customer_reviews.author: leemeewah

customer_reviews.title: I gave as a gift and received a big "thank ...
customer_reviews.text: I gave as a gift and received a big "thank you" for it. It will be used for binoculars I purchased. The strap that came with the binoculars was not the same quality as this one.
customer_reviews.author: Texas

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable & affordable
customer_reviews.text: This strap was very easy to put on my binoculars and was comfortable for extended use. I didn't give it 5 stars because the neoprene band looks a bit cheap (with no covering on the edges), but I didn't expect much given its reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: ChasM

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive marketing
customer_reviews.text: This was suggested to go along with binoculars we purchased and it is not the right size for them. Just found out packing for our trip that it doesn't work for us and now too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Vehslage

customer_reviews.title: Good Strap
customer_reviews.text: These work fine on my binoculars. For the price I think it's a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Dave G.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice fit and feel
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a a wide strap purchased from Disneyworld because the edges broke down and were scratching my neck. This new one is soft and padded and takes up less room in my bag.
customer_reviews.author: Karl R. Brobeil

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these along with the binoculars only to find out that if you use these with the Bushnell H20 Compact Binoculars this strap is to big and when they are placed on binoculars they do not fit in carry case. I planned on returning, however Amazon told me to keep - free of charge. Hope I can use them for another device. Amazon impressed me by issuing the credit!
customer_reviews.author: tir

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive option
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive and reasonably comfortable. Why pay big bucks for a Leica strap when this one does the job for a fraction of the cost. It's inexpensive, not cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Galeazzo Ciano

customer_reviews.title: WAY more comfortable than traditional straps.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as an add on for my new binoculars. I was very impressed with the comfort! My brother and dad wanted to try them and are now planning on buying them for their binos. I definitely recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Scott French

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I find the strap to be well made, attractive, and comfortable to wear. I would recommend this to a friend. I was also pleasantly surprised to find that it fits into my binocular case when wrapped around the binoculars. Jim, Dallas, TX
customer_reviews.author: James L. Trombla

customer_reviews.title: Oops
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Promptly lost the binoculars.No fault of the strap.
customer_reviews.author: Rev Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this as a quick replacement for the awful strap included with my 15x70 binoculars, and I was not disappointed! It's so very comfy, I hardy feel my heavy binos hanging from my neck while hiking or just out stargazing. My one complaint: The end of the straps were just slightly too wide for my lugs (about 1/2 inch wide) but I was able to carefully trim them down and pull them through with needle-nose pliers and reburn the ends with a lighter, rather painlessly. Time will tell how well these hold up but I've already made good use of mine and for $5 you really can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: J. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but the foam which makes up the area that ...
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable but the foam which makes up the area that contacts your shoulder is slippery and the strap slides off often. I have almost dropped my binoculars as a result several times. I am going to try and add some type of less slippery material to improve this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Genius

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought because the binocular did not say it came with a strap.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Rupert

customer_reviews.title: Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: This strap was described perfectly. Very comfortable and it was a big hit with the binoculars. The recipient was very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen G.

customer_reviews.title: Nice strap
customer_reviews.text: I got it today, and have used it. It's much more comfortable than the strap that came with the camera. It looks good, feels good, and seems well made. It's worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred R. Marzian

customer_reviews.title: Nice strap
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for binoculars that I've had forever. I did not want to spend a lot, so this strap definately fit the bill. For the money, it is made well.
customer_reviews.author: Aunt Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect strap for my Bushnell Perma Focus 12x50 Wide Angle Binoculars. Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: SFDennis

customer_reviews.title: the strap seems to be of good quality just wish I could use it
customer_reviews.text: Had to return this because it didn't fit onto my camera. However, the supplier refunded me immediately and I didn't even have to return the product. That being said, the strap seems to be of good quality just wish I could use it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is okay. It arrives immediately after I ordered it.
customer_reviews.author: Dolfo

customer_reviews.title: Hubby loves
customer_reviews.text: For my husbands ancient binoculars that he rediscovered. Looked everywhere for something to use since the original strap was missing. Works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: B. Cramer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This strap was more comfortable to wear with the binoculars I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Very good replacement strap for my new Bushnell binoculars. Reasonably priced, easy to install and very comfortable to wear. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: D. C. Carrad

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these. One for my wife and one for myself; prosumer and DSLR. We have not looked back since. If I buy another camera, I am ordering this strap again.
customer_reviews.author: ray

customer_reviews.title: Strap Rocks
customer_reviews.text: This strap works very well with our Pentax 62215 6.5x21 Papilio binoculars. It came quickly. I wish they had a better belt loop idea for the strap ends.
customer_reviews.author: Monrodeo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Strap For The Price
customer_reviews.text: I lost my D300 strap and ordered this as a quick replacement. It is comfortable with good quality construction. I cut off the ends and sewed on a strap with op tech quick release "snaps" which I also have attached to the camera. Thus, I can place camera on tripod and release from it. It works well for me and the strap doesn't yell "expensive camera". Delivery was quick with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: DShelton

product_meta.title: OP/TECH USA E-Z Comfort Strap (Black) - Neoprene Neck Strap for Cameras and Binoculars, 2701252
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:SingleThe "no frills" approach to a comfortable and functional neck strap is what OP/TECH USA offers in the E-Z Comfort Strap. The slim design and easy-to-use connection system make this a great strap for binoculars and cameras. It combines high quality neoprene, top grade leather and 3/8" (9,5mm) webbing to give you a simple, yet comfortable strap. Getting down to basics without sacrificing quality is what the E-Z Comfort Strap is all about.
feature_bullets: Streamlined neoprene design fits most camera and binoculars—including those with binocular rain guards
Easy to attach and adjust with 3/8" Wide webbing
